concern regarding a change in cognition, lower performance in episodic memory domains that is greater than would be expected for the subject's age and educational background and preservation of independence in functional abilities

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a prospective cohort study for cognitively normal (young and old), mild cognitive
      impairment, and Alzheimer's disease people

clinical_study.brief_title: Korean Brain Aging Study for Early Diagnosis and Prediction of Alzheimer's Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of the study is

        -  To search new biomarkers and develop clinically applicable early diagnosis and
           prediction methods of Alzheimer's disease.

        -  To investigate contributing factors to AD-related early brain changes through annual
           comprehensive clinical and neuropsychological evaluation and biannual brain imaging
           (MRI, Fluorodeoxyglucose(FDG)-PET, and Pittsburgh compound B (PiB)-PET) with blood
           sampling.

criteria.textblock:
Participants will be classified as either Alzheimer's disease(AD) group, mild cognitive
        impairment(MCI) group, elderly normal controls or young normal controls. Specific
        inclusion criteria for each group is described below.

        [Inclusion criteria: AD]

          -  Age : 55 - 90

          -  Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR)=0.5 or 1

          -  Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-IV(DSM-IV) criteria for dementia

          -  National Institute of Aging and the Alzheimer's Association (NIA-AA) Probable AD
             dementia

          -  Study partner or caregiver to accompany patient to all scheduled visits

          -  Written informed consent

        [Inclusion criteria: MCI (amnestic)]

          -  Age : 55 - 90

          -  Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR)=0.5

          -  Concern regarding a change in cognition (obtained from the subject, from an informant
             who knows the subject, or from a skilled clinician observing the subject)

          -  Lower performance in episodic memory domains that is greater than would be expected
             for the subject's age and educational background

          -  Preservation of independence in functional abilities

          -  Study partner or caregiver to accompany subject to all scheduled visits

          -  Written informed consent

        [Inclusion criteria: Elderly normal controls]

          -  Age : 55 - 90

          -  Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR)=0

          -  Those with contactable Informant

          -  Written informed consent

        [Inclusion criteria: Young normal controls]

          -  Age : 20 - 55

          -  Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR)=0

          -  Written informed consent

        [Exclusion criteria: general]

          -  Past history or presence of major psychiatric illness (e.g. schizophrenia, bipolar
             disorder, alcohol/substance abuse or dependence, delirium)

          -  Significant neurologic or medical condition that can influence the mental state

          -  Contraindications for MRI scan (e.g. pacemaker, claustrophobia)

          -  Illiteracy

          -  Significant visual or hearing difficulty

          -  Taking investigational drug

          -  In pregnancy or breast-feeding

study_pop.textblock:
Young and elderly normal controls: community-based population AD and MCI: clinic or
        community-based population

facility.name: Seoul National University College of Medicine

clinical_study.official_title: Korean Brain Aging Study for Early Diagnosis and Prediction of Alzheimer's Disease

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Psychiatry, Seoul National University College of Medicine

primary_outcome.description: Group difference in baseline brain amyloid deposition and the relationship between the amount of brain amyloid deposition and clinical, neuropsychological, neuroimaging, genetic, biochemical measurement will be investigated.
primary_outcome.measure: The amount of brain amyloid deposition

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Group difference for each clinical, neuropsychological, structural and functional neuroimaging, genetic, biochemical measurement and correlations among these variables will be investigated.
secondary_outcome.measure: Group difference for each clinical, neuropsychological, structural and functional neuroimaging, genetic, biochemical measurement

secondary_outcome.description: The change of brain amyloid deposition and its relation to the clinical, neuropsychological, neuroimaging, genetic and biochemical measurement will be assessed.
The change of clinical, neuropsychological measurement and the relationship between these variables and other biomarkers will be assessed.

The change of structural and functional MRI measures and glucose metabolism of the brain the relationship between these variables and other  clinical, neuropsychological, neuroimaging, biochemical, genetic biomarkers will be assessed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change of structural and functional neuroimaging measurement

secondary_outcome.description: The change of blood-based biochemical measurement and the relationship between these variables and other clinical, neuropsychological, neuroimaging, biochemical, genetic biomarkers will be assessed.

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Science, ICT, and Future Planning, Republic of Korea

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
